title: SpaceNews Icon Awards honorees: Deal of the Year
summary: This year seen some long-predicted  industry consolidation come to pass. Which of 2023's many transactions will be recognized as the Deal of the Year at the SpaceNews 2023 Icon Awards?

title: Retired Space Force Lt. Gen. Armagno joins Rocket Lab’s board of directors
summary: Rocket Lab announced Nov. 1 that retired U.S. Space Force Lt. Gen. Nina Armagno has joined the company’s board of directors.

title: Space Force awards $2.5 billion in rocket contracts to SpaceX and ULA for 21 launches
summary: The U.S. Space Force assigned 21 rocket launches to SpaceX and United Launch Alliance, worth about $2.5 billion in total, the military branch told CNBC.

title: Delta swapping out Intelsat Wi-Fi for Hughes on 400 planes
summary: Delta Air Lines has picked Hughes Network Systems to upgrade the Wi-Fi on around 400 Boeing 717 and smaller regional jets serving North America that currently use Intelsat’s inflight connectivity services.

title: Tesla investor who made billions on stock says SpaceX will be bigger
summary: A Tesla investor whose firm has made billions on the automaker’s stock says SpaceX, Elon Musk’s space exploration company, is the next...

title: Op-ed | Space Force launch strategy a step in the right direction
summary: This next phase of NSSL marks a significant evolution in how the Space Force approaches launch, leaning into the commercial market in a way that it had previously largely avoided.

title: Daily Telescope: A dazzling view of the Milky Way from southern Africa
summary: "I finally had 30 minutes or so to admire the spectacular view."

title: Kuva Space raises 16.6 million euros
summary: With the investment, Kuva Space will accelerate development of cameras and related technology for its hyperspectral satellite constellation.

title: Starship Another Step Closer to Second Test Flight
summary: SpaceX’s Starship is another step closer today to getting an FAA license to attempt a second orbital flight test. The FAA announced the company has completed all the required corrective […]

title: Ovzon gets another deadline extension to deploy first GEO satellite
summary: International regulators have given Ovzon another six months to provide services from its debut satellite following a series of manufacturing and launch delays for the project, the Swedish satcoms provider announced Oct. 31.
